intro: Machaeranthera gypsophila, commonly known as the gypsum coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its yellow to orange flowers and narrow, linear leaves adapted to arid environments. The plant thrives in well-drained soils, often found in gypsum or limestone areas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy blooms. Machaeranthera gypsophila is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
